title: How to find out that the story I am writing is not similar to any other story - Quora

response.answer_text: Using online plagiarism checkers could be a safe bet, although these won’t check if your idea for a story has already been used before. For that, simply Googling a phrase or sentence (that you feel represents your story best) would suffice. But as long as you’re able to defend yourself against accusations of plagiarism (read: don’t plagiarize) I don’t think it’s a problem if your story sounds similar to someone else’s. Harry Potter and Barry Trotter are about the same thing; that doesn’t take away any of their merit as stories, individually. Most American sitcoms and Indian serials have the same stories. That doesn’t mean people don’t watch (or read) them. There are very few writings in the world of which humankind can truly say, “There’s nothin’ else like it!” so write away!
